Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Throughout the passage, several sustainable or environmental practices have been mentioned. Some examples include reducing plastic usage, conserving water, practicing the "reduce, reuse, recycle" principle, using energy-efficient light bulbs and devices, and consuming locally sourced goods. Additionally, there has been mention of seeking out products that are certified as sustainable or environmentally friendly, reading labels to ensure safety and transparency, and avoiding items containing harmful chemicals or additives.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are numerous events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 specific events might be too extensive. Instead, I'll provide a brief overview of some notable events and initiatives related to environmental conservation. Some examples include:

1. Earth Day (April 2)
2. World Environment Day (June 5)
3. Global Climate Strike (varies)
4. National Park Service Centennial (August 25, 292)
5. United Nations Climate Change Conferences (held every two years since 195)
6. International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) World Conservation Congress (held every four years)
7. COP21 Paris Agreement Conference (December 201)
8. UN Biodiversity Conference (held every two years since 20)
9. World Wildlife Day (March 3)
10. Green Apple Awards (annual event recognizing environmental best practices)

These events and initiatives represent a small fraction of the countless efforts underway to promote environmental conservation and sustainability around the world.

“As we express our gratitude we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words but to live by them” – John F Kennedy With  rapidly approaching it’s normal to find one’s self reminiscing on the past year reflecting on the should haves and could haves We attempt to make pacts with ourselves and others in honor of the new year whether it be cutting back on one thing or trying to do more of another But how often do those promises include being kind to or showing appreciation for others In today’s high-demand fast-paced society we feel we lose the opportunity to think more about others than for ourselves This year make a pact with us to show more appreciation to our three areas of focus; People Animals and Planet Read on for ideas on how to make these changes happen within each area  An area not normally focused on yet deserves the greatest amount of attention Appreciation for people Appreciation and gratitude for our planet and animals cannot be made possible without

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Environmental impact metrics typically include measurements of greenhouse gas emissions (such as CO2), water consumption and pollution, land use and habitat destruction, air and water pollution, and waste generation. These metrics help quantify the environmental footprint of individuals, organizations, and industries, allowing for better understanding and management of environmental impacts.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, based on the provided information about Regenrus, they have made public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They are a certified B Corporation, which means they adhere to high standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. Additionally, they donate a significant portion (at least 4%) of their monthly sales to various charitable causes through their Regenrus CARES Global Charity program. Furthermore, they prioritize giving back to their community, people, animals, and the environment through their social impact model, generous giveback sharing, and caring programs.

source.content: becomes a non profit - visit regenruscaresorg  Spurring compassion into action we are proud of our give-back accomplishments annually Our social impact model seeks to have a measurable effect on three key areas people animals and our planet It's our mission to do our part in restoring balance to mother earth and hope for a better world for people and animals Regenrus™ is proud to join the elite group of certified B Benefit Corporations BCorps are businesses that are dedicated to being a Force for Good Transforming the global economy to benefit all people communities and the planet Stakeholder governance ensures that the actions of our company must benefit all stakeholders — customers employees suppliers communities and investors Regenrus™ was honored to be recognized as B Corp Top 5 Best for the World in Governance and Community We are very proud of this  Regenrus is also proud to have launched Regenrus Wellness Center A Haven for Holistic Living offering holistic services in support

Our wellness and beauty products are ethically and sustainably sourced and designed to deliver the highest degree of efficacy Through our generous giveback sharing and caring programs—along with our Regenrus Collective Wellness Center and Mindful Marketplace—we support and raise up more likeminded heart-centered products organizations and services so that together we all rise to be and become a more balanced and regenerative global community B Corps are a new type of company that uses the power of business to solve social and environmental problems We are for-profit companies certified by the non-profit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance accountability and transparency Certified B Corporations™ redefine success in business We demonstrate that a mission-based business can succeed and succeed at the highest levels Regenrus donates a minimum of 4 of all sales every month to RegenrusCARES Global Charity serving different charities locally nationally

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Through the Regenrus Partner Program, there are several high-quality, scientifically proven, certified non-toxic products available, including wellness supplements, teas, skin care products, and organic wellness products. Additionally, as a partner, you can benefit from the direct ship program, which offers repeat purchasing opportunities for your clients. Furthermore, Regenrus offers a vanity link that allows your business to provide a seamless 24x7 online shopping experience for your clients, complete with a 2-3 day priority direct ship service. Lastly, Regenrus Cares contributes 4% of all sales to various social causes for people, animals, and the planet, allowing everyone involved to feel good about the positive impact being made.

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result:
Yes, there are various promotional events, expos, and sales offered throughout the year for the Regenrus products and services. Some examples include:

1. Seasonal Sales: Regenrus often hosts seasonal sales during holidays such as Black Friday, Cyber Monday, Christmas, New Year, etc., offering discounts and special offers on select products.

1. Referral Programs: Regenrus may run referral programs where existing customers can invite friends and family to join the Regenrus Partner Program, and both parties can benefit from rewards and commission discounts.

1. Webinar Series: Regenrus occasionally organizes webinars featuring expert speakers discussing topics related to health, wellness, and personal care. These webinars might be complimentary or require a small fee, but they often include special promotions or discounts for participants.

1. Influencer Collaborations: Regenrus collaborates with influencers and social media personalities within the wellness and self-care niches. These partnerships sometimes result in limited-time promotions, exclusive discounts, or special edition product releases.

1. Trunk Shows: Occasionally, Regenrus hosts trunk shows, where representatives bring a selection of products directly to customers for them to browse, sample, and purchase. These events often feature special deals, discounts, or bonus gifts with purchase.

These are just a few examples of the promotional events, expos, and sales opportunities available for Regenrus products and services. Be sure to keep an eye out for announcements regarding upcoming events and promotions through email newsletters, social media, or direct communication from your Regenrus representative.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: In the given text, there are several notable partnerships and collaborations related to commerce. One such collaboration is the Regenrus Partner Program, which allows partners to benefit from wholesale discounts, helping them grow their business while aligning with Regenrus' purpose and values. Additionally, Regenrus has established strategic alliances with various wellness practitioners, cosmetologists, estheticians, massage therapists, educators, and other like-minded businesses. These partnerships enable Regenrus to expand its reach and influence within the industry, as well as contribute to social causes and support the growth of a regenerative global community.

Our wellness and beauty products are ethically and sustainably sourced and designed to deliver the highest degree of efficacy Through our generous giveback sharing and caring programs—along with our Regenrus Collective Wellness Center and Mindful Marketplace—we support and raise up more likeminded heart-centered products organizations and services so that together we all rise to be and become a more balanced and regenerative global community B Corps are a new type of company that uses the power of business to solve social and environmental problems We are for-profit companies certified by the non-profit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance accountability and transparency Certified B Corporations™ redefine success in business We demonstrate that a mission-based business can succeed and succeed at the highest levels Regenrus donates a minimum of 4 of all sales every month to RegenrusCARES Global Charity serving different charities locally nationally

US Air Force We now call this online learning When I left the Air Force in  as a highly decorated Captain I took this innovative technology to large corporations for the next eleven years During the following thirty years I founded co-founded or served on the board and executive teams of twenty-eight business and non-profit organizations  My teams created the first interactive videodisc training for the banking industry designed the first shopping mall computer touch screen kiosk and led the adult snowboarding industry I initiated and co-chaired the nation’s first graduate department on Leadership and Organizational Transformation served as president of the international Association for the Development of Computer-based Instructional Systems and as co-founder and Dean of the online Networking University with over  faculty and over + course enrollments from direct sales professionals around the world This journey always has me on a team It’s my most important lesson understanding the

I grew up in Richardson Texas with parents who did their best to give me a healthy and culturally rich homelife After graduating from Texas A  M in  with a degree in Business Management and a masters in Educational Psychology my first assignment as 2nd Lieutenant in the US Air Force landed me on an elite manpower management team  Our 9-member team 3 officers 6 enlisted was tasked with determining the skill and leadership requirements for every work center on the air force base where I was assigned – from the commander to the cooks in the mess hall  Of the manpower teams on over  bases across the world we earned USAF Outstanding Management Engineering Team Award for  That recognition propelled me to another team in Denver Colorado to design the first computer-based training system for the US Air Force We now call this online learning When I left the Air Force in  as a highly decorated Captain I took this innovative technology to large corporations for the next eleven years During the

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are several events happening during November at Regenrus Wellness Center. These include:

* Job Fair (November 7th): An opportunity for job seekers to connect with local employers offering remote or flexible positions.
* Webinar Series (Weekly throughout November): Expert speakers will host various webinars covering topics such as stress management, time management, and personal development.
* Workshop: "Revitalize Your Relationships" (November 20th). Participants will learn practical tools and techniques to enhance their relationships with friends, family, and romantic partners.
* Training Program: "Mindful Meditation Teacher Certification Course" (November 1st-30th). This intensive program teaches participants how to lead mindful meditation sessions for individuals and groups.

source.content: percent decline during the height of the pandemic hit “We were a young company and like many others were faced with challenges relating to the pandemic” said Tysinger “Sales were down we could have given up However instead of focusing on what we didn’t have we chose to dig deeper and build a stronger foundation that would become a launching pad/sustain us for future/etc” Over the past twelve months the company has achieved multiple major victories/accomplishments including launching their nonprofit RegenrusCARES™ gaining c3 status updating their technology achieving B-Corp status and launching a brick-and-mortar wellness center in the heart of Denton Texas Throughout the past five years the lean team worked tirelessly to become the change they want to see in the world Their efforts are paying off for the benefit of the whole Not only did the company achieve all of their strategic goals but they are also experiencing a 24 growth in their customer base a 16 increase in orders and have

and the great majority for reinvestment in the company and the community it serves Affordable housing is in the news because it’s a problem we are recognizing that is becoming important to us all Think of your home or the place where your business rents space Visualize the land it’s on being vacant empty Someone bought that land and the one who sold it probably made a profit that increased the cost of that land  Then a developer came along and decided they could buy that land build a home on it and sell it at a profit In this phase the developer hires several companies and pays each of them for their work including a profit for each The survey company the grading company the plumbing company for the waterlines and sewer pipes the foundation and concrete company and so on After all these separate profit centers build the house or commercial building the developer adds on his 15 or 20 PROFIT and asks a real estate agent to sell it or lease it earning another 5-7 on top of it all I

maintenance costs plus whatever any loan costs may be The rental costs never rise to market rate We recognize that using the home as a wealth building tool is something most of us can no longer do We have reached the tipping point where we can no longer afford the rent/mortgage payment that allows these many profit centers to make money  A new system for living must emerge and we’re working on one alternative    Here on Kauai we need 5 homes today Our goal is to build at least 1 of these over the next 5 years using 3D house printing and hemp-based construction materials as much as we can As a nonprofit we transfer our knowledge as quickly as we can to additional communities across the US and the world Other teams can build too We need your wisdom and financial support No one else is coming We’re looking for financial partners to strategize to solve this crisis Join us at our website – OhanaLegacyFoundationorg Now we have Regenrus as a social impact organization about to be certified

Good of the Whole Our planet is our home and we have a responsibility to care for it My passion is to inspire and guide individuals groups and organizations to live their dreams while contributing to the good of the Whole  I’m seeing the next evolution of capitalism of business moving from the sole purpose of enriching investors and shareholders to a nonprofit model where business exists to enrich our communities  Anyone who provides the financial capital to start the business can be repaid from the income with a reasonable limit on ongoing profit An example might be that an investor earns a small percentage say 2 of the business profits over several years instead of  of the profits in perpetuity Nonprofit business can maximize revenues pay good salaries and earn money A little for the investors and the great majority for reinvestment in the company and the community it serves Affordable housing is in the news because it’s a problem we are recognizing that is becoming important to us

regenerative life built on the power of four pillars or concepts “Synergy” “Fearlessness” “Balance” and “Awareness”  Synergy – Bringing people together to collaborate and join forces so we may use our collective gifts to energize the causes we believe in knowing True Care is “Care in Action” Formulating product blends and business strategies that are designed around synergy where the sum of the whole is greater than the individual parts  Fearlessness – Is not the absence of fear or having no fears at all it is having the courage to not let our fears stop us from what we know we are called to do So much of our suffering and worry is what holds us back so at Regenrus we must Face Everything and RISE FEAR together Through facing our fears it allows us the freedom to break free of what is holding us back and live more joyful  Balance – To integrate work life and purpose to live our most vibrant lives yet We must be advocates for our own self-care and teach others to do the same We can

B Corps in the world  The company is recognized for generating the greatest positive impact in two categories – community and governance This speaks not only to their commitment for providing quality products but also to their commitment to supporting the growth and development of their local national and global community The visionary leaders behind Regenrus are fully committed to providing a collective haven for holistic living” It’s easy to see why B Corp ranks Regenrus in the top 5 Best for the World of all B Corps in their corresponding size group Best for the World presents an opportunity for recognized companies to collaborate and share best practices within the B Corp community and businesses outside of the community to promote continued conscious innovation around the world As a family-owned women-led heart-centered and science-based B-Corp the health and wellness of individuals and the community is at the forefront of Regenrus’ business initiatives The company is committed

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The organization is collaborating with various organizations, institutions, and entities to achieve its goals and create positive change in the world. Some of these partners include B Corps, which are for-profit companies certified by the non-profit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency; Regenrus Wellness Center, a haven for holistic living offering holistic services in support of overall well-being; and Regenrus CARES, a non-profit organization focused on philanthropic efforts and social impact initiatives. Additionally, they mention working alongside other like-minded individuals, organizations, and causes that share their values and vision for a better world.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Yes, there are several joint events, projects, and initiatives mentioned in the text. Some notable examples include:

1. Soviet-American Citizen Summit: A massive undertaking that required collaboration between both countries. It aimed to establish connections and promote understanding between the two nations.
2. Preparation for receiving the largest group of Soviet citizens: This event also demanded collaboration between American and Soviet teams to ensure a successful reception of the distinguished guests.
3. Establishment of the Revolutionary Agreements: Both American and Soviet teams came together to create a set of principles that would guide their actions and interactions, promoting collaboration and mutual respect.
4. Regenrus Cares: As a woman-owned, science-based, and heart-centered organization, Regenrus has embraced various initiatives focused on social impact and making a difference in the world. Through Regenrus Cares, the company demonstrates its commitment to nurturing talent, empowerment, and collaboration.

between the cultures    “It was life changing for most of the people involved” says Marian Marian and her husband Glenn were invited when it became apparent that the American team was not prepared to receive the largest group of Soviet citizens to be allowed to leave their country They were able to focus the team by using their Agreements and preparing for a positive reception of these distinguished guests We quickly realized that the team members were under so much stress that they were not living their own noble mission to foster collaboration” says Marian “We went offsite worked through the Agreements and reorganized the team Rather than one man at the top three women emerged to work collaboratively to lead the initiative to success” The agreements are based on truth acceptance and gratitude and according to Marian when practiced regularly have a positive impact on your life personally and professionally  The Revolutionary Agreements were established to support people living to our

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Through these collaborations, there are several mutual objectives and desired outcomes. Some key goals include:

1. Achieving success and operating effectively: Collaborations aim to achieve common goals while working efficiently and intelligently. By combining resources and expertise, participants hope to accomplish more than they could individually.
2. Changing the world: Many collaborations strive to create positive change in various aspects such as health, environmental sustainability, and social justice. Participants seek to leave a lasting impact on society through their combined efforts.
3. Fostering a supportive community: Collaborations often focus on nurturing a strong sense of camaraderie and belonging among its members. This helps to encourage personal growth, creativity, and innovation.
4. Promoting a regenerative lifestyle: Groups collaborate to raise awareness and advocate for eco-friendly, sustainable practices that prioritize the well-being of people, animals, and the planet.
5. Generating measurable social impact: Collaborations aim to produce tangible results that positively affect communities and society at large. By pooling resources and talents, participants hope to make a significant difference in areas such as education, healthcare, and environmental conservation.
6. Building long-lasting relationships: Effective collaboration involves establishing trust, open communication, and mutual respect between participants. Strong relationships enable continued collaboration and support for each other's endeavors.

University with over  faculty and over + course enrollments from direct sales professionals around the world This journey always has me on a team It’s my most important lesson understanding the importance of team The people we choose to be around to share our inspirations and form a common commitment to an important mission we become a team that can make a difference in the world We can have fun together   I met Marian in  at an international conference in Montreal I was smart enough to invite her to join our consulting team and she accepted A few years later we married and have been life partners ever since We both took a workshop based on the works of Buckminster Fuller He coined the term Spaceship Earth We learned an even greater appreciation for thinking from the perspective of the Good of the Whole Our planet is our home and we have a responsibility to care for it My passion is to inspire and guide individuals groups and organizations to live their dreams while contributing to
